marketNews.title: Merdeka Group 2Q25 Performance: MDKA Pressured, MBMA Strengthened
marketNews.content: The Merdeka Group reported its 2Q25 performance where Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) and Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) showed contrasting results. MDKA recorded a net loss of US$12 million in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: US$4 million loss, 2Q24: US$3 million profit). This result brought MDKA's net loss for 1H25 to US$16 million (vs. 1H24: US$13 million loss), below consensus expectations which projected a net profit of US$3 million for 2025F. Conversely, MBMA recorded a net profit of US$9 million in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: US$3 million loss, 2Q24: US$17 million profit). This result brought MBMA's net profit for 1H25 to US$6 million (-71% YoY), below consensus expectations, equivalent to only 23% of the consensus 2025F net profit estimate.

marketNews.title: MDKA: Pressured by Decline in Gold & Copper Sales
marketNews.content:
Gold (Weakening) - Although the average realized gold selling price rose significantly to US$3,207 per troy ounce (+16% QoQ, +42% YoY), realized gold sales volume dropped to 22,739 oz (-38% QoQ, -9% YoY). This is potentially caused by massive earlier sales in 1Q25 where MDKA sold 36,796 oz of gold despite only producing 25,481 oz of gold. In terms of production, the gold production volume increased +2% YoY to 50,624 tons during 1H25, equivalent to 46-51% of the company's guidance, with a stable cash cost at US$1,125 per troy ounce, which is within company guidance (US$1,100-1,250 per troy ounce).
Copper (Weakening) - Copper sales volume fell -41% QoQ to 1,742 tons, in line with the planned cessation of mining activities at the Wetar mine expected in 3Q25. Nevertheless, copper production will continue through processing remaining stockpiles, with leaching and copper recovery processes expected to continue until 1Q27. In terms of production, copper production volume decreased -37% YoY to 4,235 tons during 1H25, equivalent to 35-42% of company guidance, with cash cost rising +13% YoY to US$3.0/lb, which is within company guidance (US$3.0-3.2/lb).

marketNews.title: MBMA: Improved NPI & Limonite Margins
marketNews.content:
Limonite Ore (Improving) - MBMA's realized limonite ore sales rose to 2.8 million wmt (+33% QoQ, -3% YoY) in 2Q25, in line with increased demand from affiliated HPAL facilities. Meanwhile, cash cost significantly dropped from ~US$13 per wmt to US$11 per wmt, following a change in the ore logistics system from hauling using dump trucks to slurry pipes. In terms of production, limonite ore production volume increased +43% YoY to 4.3 million tons during 1H25, equivalent to 29-34% of company guidance.
NPI (Improving) - MBMA successfully controlled the NPI cash cost to US$9,719 per ton (-3% QoQ, -6% YoY), below company guidance (US$11,000 per ton), while the average realized selling price remained stable at US$11,500 per ton (-1% QoQ, -0% YoY). In terms of production, NPI production volume decreased -23% YoY to 33,045 tons during 1H25, equivalent to 41-47% of the company's new, lower guidance of 70-80 thousand tons compared to the previous guidance of 80-87 thousand tons.
Nickel Matte (Neutral) - Nickel matte production has been halted since 1Q25 due to thin margins. Production may potentially resume in 4Q25 at the earliest if price conditions improve.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Following the release of 2Q25 performance and earnings calls, MBMA closed up +25% (upper price limit/ARA), while MDKA gained +7.25% in trading on Friday (26/9). Between the projects currently being developed by the Merdeka Group, we assess that MBMA's near-term performance outlook is more visible, while MDKA's performance outlook tends to materialize in the medium term. MBMA's NPI segment is expected to maintain cash costs below US$10,000 per ton so that profitability remains secure, while limonite sales potential will increase along with the operation of affiliated HPAL facilities. Furthermore, the commissioning progress of the AIM project is relatively good with full production expectations in 2026. On the other hand, MDKA's Tujuh Bukit gold production is projected to meet guidance (100-110 thousand oz) with a more even gold sales distribution (between quarters) in 2H25. Meanwhile, Merdeka Gold Resources' (EMAS) Pani project is expected to produce its first gold in 1Q26. For copper, the contribution from Wetar will continue to decline, while exploration at the Tujuh Bukit project still lacks a definite production schedule.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know...
marketNews.content:
Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, on Friday (26/9) announced that the government will not raise cigarette excise tax in 2026 after discussions with the cigarette producers' association, GAPPRI. Purbaya explained that he wanted to lower the rate, but the producers requested that the amount remain unchanged. He added that his main focus now is cleaning up the illegal cigarette market both from abroad and domestically by forming a special system for the tobacco product industry (IHT).
The Institute of International Finance reported that global debt hit a new record high of US$337.7 trillion at the end of 2Q25. This was driven by the easing of global financial conditions, the weakening of the US dollar, and a more accommodative stance from major central banks. The countries recording the highest debt increases (in US dollars) were China, France, the United States, Germany, the United Kingdom, and Japan.
US economic growth in 2Q25 was revised sharply higher to 3.8% annualized in the final report (vs. 3.3% in the second estimate), marking the highest increase in the last 2 years. Strong consumer spending and business investment were growth drivers, but growth momentum is starting to slow down due to the effects of tariffs and policy uncertainty.
US President, Donald Trump, announced on Thursday (25/9) that the US will impose a 100% import tariff on branded drugs, a 25% tariff on heavy-duty trucks, and 30-50% on cabinets and furniture. The announcement - made on the social media platform Truth Social - did not include details such as whether the tariffs would be added to the country of origin tariffs or if there were exceptions for countries that already have trade agreements with the US. The newly announced tariffs are planned to take effect on October 1, 2025.
Shareholders of Fuji Finance Indonesia (FUJI), Jhon Veter Firdaus, bought ~6.3 million FUJI shares at an average price of 790 rupiah per share on September 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Jhon Veter Firdaus' direct ownership proportion in FUJI increased from 12.23% to 12.72%.
Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) estimates the effective date for the separation from Bank Syariah Nasional, resulting from the spin-off of its sharia business unit (UUS), will fall on December 15, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the EGMS on November 18, 2025. This separation is motivated by BBTN's UUS assets having reached 54 trillion rupiah in 2023, exceeding the 50 trillion rupiah limit that mandates a spin-off.

marketNews.content: "Great Investors Are Not Those Who Are Always Right, But Those Who Are Always in Control." - Stockbiz8

tickerNews.title: BTPS 8M25: Net Profit +24% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) recorded a net profit of 112 billion rupiah in August 2025 (+5% MoM, +45% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 8M25 to 861 billion rupiah (+24% YoY), equivalent to 68% of the consensus 2025F consolidation estimate (vs. 8M24: 65% realization of 2024 consolidated net profit). The net profit performance during 8M25 was supported by a decrease in provision expenses (-44% YoY), although PPOP still dropped -12% YoY due to a weakening Net Margin Income (NMI) (-4% YoY) and an increase in opex (+5% YoY). The weakening NMI during 8M25 aligns with financing contraction of -4% YoY (vs. 1H25: -3% YoY, 8M24: -13% YoY), but Net Interest Income slightly decreased to 23% (vs. 8M24: 24%).

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) Discloses Open Gold Mine News, Reveals Plans
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) Investor Relations, Ari Setiawan, on Thursday (25/9) stated that the Doup project is expected to be operational in 2028 with a gold production level of 140,000 to 155,000 ounces per year. To this end, the company plans to build a processing plant and supporting infrastructure with a capacity of 3,000 tons of ore per year.

tickerNews.title: Total Bangun Persada (TOTL) Plans Business Expansion in Various Construction Sectors
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada (TOTL) plans to add business activities in the sectors: 1) telecommunication central construction, 2) water resource infrastructure construction, 3) non-fishing port construction, 4) civil construction for oil & gas, mining, geothermal, other civil buildings, sports facilities, chemical product processing, petrochemicals, pharmaceuticals, and other industries. This plan will be discussed at the EGMS on November 3, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Green Era Energy Affiliate Sells BREN Shares to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy shareholders affiliated with the controller, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold ~84.6 million BREN shares on September 22, 2025, at an average price of 8,247 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached ~698 billion rupiah and was conducted to increase the free float of shares circulating in the market. After this transaction, Green Era Energy's ownership decreased from ~21.99% to ~21.92%.

tickerNews.title: PGAS 8M25 Performance Update: Gas Sales Volume Dip, Transmission Volume Rises
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) recorded a gas sales volume of 830 BBtud during 8M25 (-2% YoY), which is lower by about 4-13% from the 2025 target in the range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,627 MMSCFD during 8M25 (+8% YoY), which is +13% higher than the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD. The upstream sales volume reached 15,844 BOEPD during 8M25 (-21% YoY), which is -8% lower than the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: Jhon Veter Firdaus Increases Direct Ownership in Fuji Finance Indonesia (FUJI)
tickerNews.content: Fuji Finance Indonesia (FUJI) shareholder, Jhon Veter Firdaus, bought ~6.3 million FUJI shares at an average price of 790 rupiah per share on September 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Jhon Veter Firdaus' direct ownership portion in FUJI increased from 12.23% to 12.72%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) Estimates Sharia Unit Spin-Off Effective Date
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) estimates the effective date for the separation from Bank Syariah Nasional, resulting from the spin-off of its sharia business unit (UUS), will fall on December 15, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the EGMS on November 18, 2025. This separation is motivated by BBTN's UUS assets having reached 54 trillion rupiah in 2023, exceeding the 50 trillion rupiah limit that mandates a spin-off.
